intro: Hippocrepis squamata f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its lanceolate, broad leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, calcareous soils and is found in meadows and rocky habitats. It is a perennial species that thrives in temperate climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation areas.
